citation.article-title: Alkalispirillum mobile gen. nov., spec. nov., an alkaliphilic non-phototrophic member of the Ectothiorhodospiraceae

p.s: Alkalispirillum (Al.ka.li.spi.ril'lum. Arab.n. al kali alkaline; L.n. n. spirillum, spiral; Alkalispirillum an alkaline-loving spiral)
Motile by means of a single polar flagellum.
Grows under aerobically alkaline and saline conditions.

Phylogenetically, the genus Alkalispirillum, as a member of the family of the Ectothiorhodospiraceae, represents a deeply branching lineage in the γ-subclass of the Proteobacteria (Stackebrandt et al. 1996).
The mol% G+C of the DNA of the type strain of the type species is 66.2±0.5.
